newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares end lower on international trends.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares end lower on international trends.

text.p: In line with international trends, Swedish shares ended lower on Wednesday as Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan's Friday comments about "irrational exuberance" of financial markets lingered.
"The market is noticeably cautious after Greenspan's statement last Friday and it feels as if nervousness will continue tomorrow," a trader said.
The general index dropped 1.81 percent to 2,281.97 in turnover of 3.98 billion crowns.
Plummeting shares in drugs company Astra also had a negative impact. The stock closed 9.5 crowns down at 329.5.
Astra, which has been driven by rumours that Swiss rival Roche will place a takeover bid on the company, started falling back on Tuesday as rumours subsided.
On Wednesday, investment company Investor's chief executive Claes Dahlback said that Roche had not contacted Investor about its Astra stake. Investor dropped four crowns to 281 crowns.
Telecommunications group Ericsson dropped five crowns to 200 crowns. But the market took little notice that the company was sued by U.S. telecommunications group Qualcomm regarding patents.
